intro: Neotessmannia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plants typically grow to a height of 10–30 cm and prefer bright, indirect light. Neotessmannia species are often cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and flowers. They are also valued for their ability to thrive in a range of indoor environments.
